data.title: Pablo Martin Named To Ben Hogan Award Watch List
data.meta_description: Oklahoma State sophomore Pablo Martin has been named to the watch list for the 2006 Ben Hogan Award it was announced on Wednesday by Bank of America, in coop...
data.text:
Oklahoma State sophomore Pablo Martin has been named to the watch list for the 2006 Ben Hogan Award it was announced on Wednesday by Bank of America, in cooperation with Colonial Country Club, The Friends of Golf and the Golf Coaches Association of America.

A native of Malaga, Spain, Martin is one of 26 players on the list for the award that is presented annually to the top men's NCAA Division I, II, III, NAIA or junior college golfer taking into account all collegiate and amateur competitions during the last 12 months.

Martin was named a semifinalist for the award last season after winning two events on his way to claiming the Phil Mickelson Award as the nation's top freshman, as well as first-team All-America honors.

This season, he won the Ping/Golfweek Preview and the Isleworth-UCF Collegiate Invitational to begin the fall season and is currently ranked No. 1 in the Golfweek/Sagarin Performance Index. Martin is carrying a team-best 68.92 stroke average and has not finished out of the top three in any of the squad's four tournaments this year.

On the amateur circuit this past summer, Martin won the prestigious Porter Cup and was a member of the European Palmer Cup.

The Hogan Award selection committee will announce 10 semifinalists on March 29 and name three finalists on May 2. The three finalists will attend The Hogan Award banquet on Saturday, May 13 at Colonial Country Club Â the Saturday prior to the Bank of America Colonial - with the recipient announced that evening.
